path: 2025/Spring/PSY-101 - Intro to Psychology/What is Psychology/Chapter 12/Attachments/Pasted Image 20250422141521_858.png
text: Conflicts are not what you think! Conflict - a situation in which a person must choose between 2 or more needs, desires, or demands = 4 basic forms of conflict = Approach-approach conflict - choosing between 2 likable events (least amount of stress) = Avoidance-avoidance conflict - choosing between 2 undesirable events = Approach-avoidance conflict — person faced with a desire or need that has both positive and negative aspects = Multiple approach-avoidance conflicts — involve several choices, each with positive and negative aspects
